page.title: 16EDUCATION
page.content: crafts. Travel to and from school is by bus, car, bicycle or on foot. Linton Village College, built in 1936 accommodates 673 children aged between 11 and 16 from Linton, Balsham, West Wratting, Abington, Shudy and Castle Camps. The pupils study a varied curr- iculum to C.S.E. or O level standard and are taught in mixed ability tutor groups. The College also facilitates a very wide community education prog- ramme. After Linton Village College you can attend Sixth Form College in Cambridge to gain A level standard. About 600 students have a choice of subjects - none is compulsory. There is no uni- form. Peter Richards, who lived in Abington, attended the local schools and then went to Trent Polytechnic in Nottingham.
